name: 2-(trifluoromethyl)benzonitrile
Reason: 2-(trifluoromethyl)benzonitrile is a derivative of benzonitrile, which has a melting point of -13.2°C. The trifluoromethyl group increases the melting point due to the electronegativity of fluorine, which leads to stronger intermolecular dipole-dipole interactions. Each fluorine atom is estimated to increase the melting point by approximately 15°C, giving a total increase of (15°C x 3 fluorines) = 45°C.
